attributes.action: A law on car dealerships to not sell used cars exceeding manufacturer guidelines
attributes.additional_details:
Currently the HP company along with the dealership are putting a case stating the sale of a used car "can exceed the manufacturer's recommendations and this would not render the vechile of unsatisfactory quality." What is a grey area is how long this can be exceeded before deemed unfit for purpose and unsatisfactory in accordance to existing legislation.

I propose a law where manufacturer guidelines are honoured or a set time frame for repair is done before purchase of a used car to the public.
attributes.background: I bought a car from a dealership whereby two months before purchase an urgent note left by the manufacturer service centre stating a cambelt had exceeded it's lifespan, of which wasn't replaced. A law must safeguard guidelines and consumers from dealerships breaching manufacturer  recommendations.
